org.unc.lac.javapetriconcurrencymonitor.petrinets

Class PetriNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unc.lac.javapetriconcurrencymonitor.petrinets.PetriNet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PlaceTransitionPetriNet, TimedPetriNet

    public abstract class PetriNet
extends java.lang.Object
    Implementation for petri net model. This class describes a general basic petri net. Every special petri net type (timed, colored, stochastic, etc) has to extend this class

    • Constructor Detail

      • PetriNet

        protected PetriNet(Place[] _places,
                   Transition[] _transitions,
                   Arc[] _arcs,
                   java.lang.Integer[] _initialMarking,
                   java.lang.Integer[][] _preI,
                   java.lang.Integer[][] _posI,
                   java.lang.Integer[][] _I,
                   java.lang.Boolean[][] _inhibitionMatrix,
                   java.lang.Boolean[][] _resetMatrix,
                   java.lang.Integer[][] _readerMatrix)
        Makes a PetriNet Object. This is intended to be used by PetriNetFactory
        Parameters:
        _places - Array of Place objects (dimension p)
        _transitions - Array of Transition objects (dimension t)
        _arcs - Array of Arcs
        _initialMarking - Array of Integers (tokens in each place) (dimension p)
        _preI - Pre-Incidence matrix (dimension p*t)
        _posI - Post-Incidence matrix (dimension p*t)
        _I - Incidence matrix (dimension p*t)
        _inhibitionMatrix - Pre-Incidence matrix for inhibition arcs only. If no inhibition arcs, null is accepted.
        _resetMatrix - Pre-Incidence matrix for reset arcs only. If no reset arcs, null is accepted.
        _readerMatrix - Pre-Incidence matrix for reader arcs only. If no reader arcs, null is accepted.

    • Method Detail

      • computeEnabledTransitions

        protected abstract boolean[] computeEnabledTransitions()
        Compute all enabled transitions according to each particular net's requirements
        Returns:
        An array where true means that transition is enabled

      • initializePetriNet

        public void initializePetriNet()
        Initialize the petri net and computes enabled transitions for the first time. This method must be called before being ready to fire a transition.
        See Also:
        computeEnabledTransitions()

      • fire

        public PetriNetFireOutcome fire(int transitionIndex)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                PetriNetException
        Fires the transition whose index is given as argument if it's enabled and updates current marking.
        Parameters:
        transitionIndex - Transition's index to be fired.
        Returns:
        true if t was fired.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If transitionIndex is negative or greater than the last transition index.
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding the petri occurs, for instance if the net hasn't been initialized before calling this method.

      • fire

        public PetriNetFireOutcome fire(Transition transition)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                PetriNetException
        Fires the transition given as argument if it's enabled and updates current marking.
        Parameters:
        transition - Transition to be fired.
        Returns:
        true if transition was fired.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If transition is null or if it doesn't match any transition index
        NotInitializedPetriNetException - If the net hasn't been initialized before calling this method
        PetriNetException - If an error regarding the petri occurs, for instance if the net hasn't been initialized before calling this method.

      • getEnabledTransitions

        public boolean[] getEnabledTransitions()
        gets the transitions array and evaluates each one if is enabled or not.
        Returns:
        a boolean array that contains if each transition is enabled or not (true or false)

               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        placeName - The name of the place to find.
        Returns:
        A copy of the place whose name is placeName
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If no place matches placeName

      • getTransition

        public Transition getTransition(java.lang.String transitionName)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Looks for a transition whose name matches transitionName and returns it. If it doesn't exist, IllegalArgumentException is thrown
        Parameters:
        transitionName - The name of the transition to look for
        Returns:
        The tansition found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if transitionName doesn't match any transition

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(int transitionIndex)
        Checks if the transition whose index is passed is enabled. Disabling causes:
      • Feeding places don't meet arcs weights requirements
      • Guard has different value than required
Returns:
whether the transition is enabled or not

  • isEnabled

    public boolean isEnabled(Transition t)
    Checks if a transition is enabled
    Parameters:
    t - Transition objects to check if it's enabled
    Returns:
    True if the transition is enabled, False otherwise

  • addGuard

    public boolean addGuard(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.Boolean value)
    Adds a new guard to the petriNet or updates a guard's value. Intended only for internal using. Use PetriMonitor.setGuard(String, boolean) instead
    Parameters:
    key - the guard name
    value - the new value
    Returns:
    True when succeeded

  • readGuard

    public boolean readGuard(java.lang.String guard)
                  throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
    Used to read a guard's value
    Parameters:
    guard - Guard name to get its value
    Returns:
    the specified guard's value
    Throws:
    java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the guard does not exist

  • getGuardsAmount

    public int getGuardsAmount()
    Returns:
    The amount of guards stored

  • isMatrixNonZero

    protected boolean isMatrixNonZero(java.lang.Boolean[][] matrix)
    Checks if all elements in the matrix are false. This is used to know if the petri has the type of arcs described by the matrix semantics.
    Parameters:
    matrix - specifies the kind of arcs
    Returns:
    True if the matrix doesn't have all entries as false.

  • isMatrixNonZero

    protected boolean isMatrixNonZero(java.lang.Integer[][] matrix)
    Checks if all elements in the matrix are zero. This is used to know if the petri has the type of arcs described by the matrix semantics.
    Parameters:
    matrix - specifies the kind of arcs
    Returns:
    True if the matrix is not all zeros.
